dublinCore.dc:title: 117 HR 8305 IH: Defense Maintenance Data Transparency Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Ms. Foxx (for herself and Ms. Speier) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Armed Services

form.official-title: To amend title 10, United States Code, to require the Secretary of Defense to develop guidelines and resources on the acquisition or licensing of intellectual property, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Defense Maintenance Data Transparency Act.

section.header: Guidelines and resources on the acquisition or licensing of intellectual property
section.text: Section 3791 of title 10, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following new subsection:

paragraph.text: The Secretary of Defense, acting through the Under Secretary of Defense for Acquisition and Sustainment, shall develop guidelines and resources on the acquisition or licensing of intellectual property, including—

subparagraph.text: model forms for specially negotiated licenses described under section 3774(c) of this title (as appropriate); and
an identification of definitions, key terms, examples, and case studies that resolve ambiguities in the differences between—

clause.text: form, fit, and function data; and
data required for operations, maintenance, installation, and training.

paragraph.text: In developing the guidelines and resources described in paragraph (1), the Secretary shall regularly consult with appropriate persons.
